speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Your smile is a hit! You deserve hot porotta with some chicken.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: My data analysis suggests that this is a fleeting happiness. A tiny pazhampori is sufficient. Don't waste energy.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Why the long face, son? Two parotta and beef fry will fix that sadness.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: According to my psychological profile, sadness is due to a lack of philosophical clarity. A strong, black kattan chaya is the only cure.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Looks like you're about to explode! Have a biryani. Itâ€™s too good to be angry about.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: The data points to a misdiagnosed emotion. It's not anger, it's just a sudden hunger for kappa biriyani. Logical, isn't it?

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Wow, a surprise! A masaladosa should be a good follow-up.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: Surprise is a fleeting emotion. For a more stable experience, I recommend appam and stew.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: You look completely blank. Get a pazhampori to add some flavor to your life.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: This neutrality is a dangerous illusion. A good chicken curry will bring you to your senses.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: You seem disgusted. A hot tea should be enough to clean your palate.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: My data suggests the disgust is not from food, but from a bad social media experience. Putta and kadala curry will cleanse your soul.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Don't be scared! A spicy chicken curry will give you courage.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: Fear causes a feeling of emptiness in the stomach. A sweet unniyappam will fill that void.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Happy, happy, happy! You deserve some kappa and meen curry.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: This happiness is an anomaly. A black kattan chaya will reset your emotional equilibrium.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Dude, cheer up! A couple of porotta with some chicken curry will make you forget everything.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: Emotional distress is a temporary state. A strong, hot kattan chaya is a scientifically proven temporary solution.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Cool down, man! A masaladosa will make you a happy person again.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: The anger is a byproduct of low energy levels. A dosa and chutney will calm your nerves and recharge your system.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Your face is full of wonder! Pathiri with egg curry will complete the day.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: That's a very short-lived emotion. Appam and stew will give you a long-lasting, memorable experience.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: A blank canvas. Dosa with sambar it is.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: Data suggests that a blank expression is a sign of deep thought. That calls for a thought-provoking kappa biriyani.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Disgusted? Don't even think about it. Just have a tea.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: The disgust is not aimed at me or my food. That's a good thing. Puttu and kadala curry for the win.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Don't be afraid! A fish curry and rice will comfort you.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: Fear creates a vacuum in the stomach. Idli and sambar will fill it right up.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: So happy! A sweet unniyappam is the perfect treat.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: My analysis indicates that your happiness is a fleeting illusion. A kattan chaya will bring you back to reality.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Sadness is a temporary emotion. Two porotta and chicken curry will fix it.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: Sadness needs a moment of silence. A hot kattan chaya will help you think.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Your face is burning! A masaladosa will cool you down.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: The anger is a sign of low blood sugar. Dosa and chutney will fix that.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: That's a nice surprise! Pathiri and egg curry will keep it going.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: Surprise is an unstable emotion. A stable dosa and sambar will keep you grounded.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: A blank face. Dosa it is.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: This neutrality is a deep emotional state. A complex kappa biriyani is the only solution.

speakerA.name: Thattukada Karan
speakerA.text: Disgusted? Don't worry. A hot tea will make it all better.

speakerB.name: Ammaavan
speakerB.text: The disgust is not with the food. Puttu and kadala curry will solve the problem.

speakerA.text: You look scared! A fish curry and rice will comfort you.
